div.l: Comth seli Iohn and with him comth Alein
Allas quod Iohn that I was born
Now ar we driuen till heuing and to scorn
Oure corn is stolne men wil vs fonnes calle
Bothe the wardein̄ and oure felawes alle
And nameli the Millere welawey
Thus pleigneth Iohn as he goth bi the way
Toward the mille and bayard in his honde
The Millere sitting bi the fire he fonde
For it was niȝt and forther miȝt they nouȝt
But for the loue of god they him besouȝt
Of herberugh and of ese as for her peny
The Millere said agein if hiere be eny
Such as it is yit shal ye haue your part
Myn hous is streit but ye han lerned art
Ye can be argumentez make a place
A mile brood of xxᵗⁱ foot of space
Lat se now if this place suffise
Or make it rome with speche as is your guise
Now Simond said this Iohn be seint Cuthberde
Ay is thou mery · and that is faire answerde
I haue herd say men sall ta of twa thingkesthinkesthinges
Slike as he fyndes or slike as he bringes
But specialli I pray the hoost dere
Gar vs haue mete and drink ⁊and make vs chere
And we shal paye truly at the fulle
With empti handes men may no haukes tulle
Lo hiere oure siluer redy for to spende
This Millere to the toun his douȝter sende
For bred and ale and rosted hem a goos
And bonde her hors it shuld nomore go loos
And in his ougne chambre hem made a bed
With shetes and with chalons faire I spred
Nat from his ougne bed x · foot or xij
His douȝter had a bedde al be hir selue
Riȝt in the same chambre by and by
It miȝt be no bet and cause whi
Ther was no rommer herber in the place
They soupen and speken of solace
And drenken euer strong ale ate beste
Aboute midniȝt they went to reste
Wel hath this Miller vernisshed his hed
